Class GameInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameInterface

  • public class GameInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is where the game plays out. This class runs through an entire game of battleships and loaded games of battleships. This class also allow the user to save the current state of the game and also return to the menu
    Author:
    Jamie

      Default constructor initialising fields to their default value

      A method that runs a player vs computer version of battleship, either stating a new game or loading a previous game Player and computer takes turns independently until 1 sides ships are all destroyed or until player quits the game

    • Method Detail

      • startGame

        public void startGame(boolean pvp,
                      boolean loadGame)
        This method starts a game, choosing which game mode and if it is a loaded game from input parameters.
        Parameters:
        pvp - - boolean used to see which game mode was selected
        loadGame - - boolean used to see if game needs loaded

      • loadGame

        public void loadGame()
        this method is used to load a previously saved game, by reading save game data from a text file

      • playerVsComputer

        public void playerVsComputer(boolean loadGame)
        A method that runs a player vs computer version of battleship, either stating a new game or loading a previous game Player and computer takes turns independently until 1 sides ships are all destroyed or until player quits the game
        Parameters:
        loadGame - - boolean used to see if game is being loaded or starting new game.

      • playerVsPlayer

        public void playerVsPlayer(boolean loadGame)
        A method that runs a player vs player version of battleship, either stating a new game or loading a previous game. Each player takes turns independently until 1 players ships are all destroyed or until 1 player quits the game
        Parameters:
        loadGame - - boolean used to see if game is being loaded or starting new game.

      • playerTurn

        public boolean playerTurn(Grid grid,
                          Grid shipGrid,
                          Grid opponentShipGrid,
                          java.lang.String opponent,
                          int oppHits,
                          int oppMisses)
        this method is for either players turn. It allows the player the choice to fire on the grid or access an options menu
        Parameters:
        grid - - this turns players grid
        shipGrid - - this turns players ship grid
        opponentShipGrid - - the opponents ship grid
        opponent - - String holding the opponents name(player2 or computer)
        oppHits - - integer holding the opponents number of hits
        oppMisses - - integer holding the opponents number of misses
        Returns:
        - a boolean to see if quit game option has been selected

      • optionsMenu

        public boolean optionsMenu(Grid playerShipGrid,
                           Grid opponentShipGrid,
                           java.lang.String opponent,
                           int oppHits,
                           int oppMisses)
        This method gives the players a choice of options. to return to game, display scoreboard, save their game, show their ships, show enemy ships.
        Parameters:
        playerShipGrid - - this turns players ship grid
        opponentShipGrid - - the opponents ship grid
        opponent - - String holding the opponents name(player2 or computer)
        oppHits - - integer holding the opponents number of hits
        oppMisses - - integer holding the opponents number of misses
        Returns:
        - a boolean to see if quit game option has been selected

        public void writeGrid(Grid grid,
                      java.io.PrintWriter printWriter)
        this method is used to write values of a grid Object into a file
        Parameters:
        grid - - the grid that is being written into the file
        printWriter - - the PrintWriter used to write to file

        opponentShipGrid - - the opponents ship grid

      • takeshot

        public void takeshot(int row,
                     int col,
                     Grid grid,
                     Grid opponentShipGrid)
        this method is used to determine if a player or computers shot was a hit or a miss
        Parameters:
        row - - integer for the row coordinate
        col - - integer for the column coordinate
        grid - - the grid of the player or computer that fired the shot
        opponentShipGrid - - the ship grid being fired on

      • placeShips

        public boolean placeShips(boolean shipCanBePlaced,
                          int row,
                          int col,
                          int eachShip,
                          int direction,
                          Grid shipGrid)
        this method is used to check if a ship can be place and if it can it place the ship on the grid
        Parameters:
        shipCanBePlaced - - boolean to store if a ship can be placed
        row - - integer for the row coordinate of a ship starting position
        col - - integer for the column coordinate of a ship starting position
        eachShip - - integer holding the index number of the ship to be placed
        direction - - integer holding the a number to signify the direction a ship will be drawn onto the grid
        shipGrid - - the grid that the ship will be placed on
        Returns:
        - boolean if ship was placed or not

      • getRandomNumber

        public static int getRandomNumber(int min,
                                  int max)
        this method returns a random integer from a range from parameters
        Parameters:
        min - - integer holding the minimum value that could be returned
        max - - integer holding the maximum value that could be returned
        Returns:
        - integer of result
